net.sf.JRecord.Details

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.JRecord.Details.BaseLine
      • net.sf.JRecord.Details.BasicLine
        • net.sf.JRecord.Details.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractIndexedLine, IGetData, ILineFieldNames, AbstractLine, IGetByteData

    public class Line
extends BasicLine
implements IGetByteData
    This class represents one line (or Record) in the File. It contains methods to Get / update fields (for a specified layouts) get the preferred layout etc

    The one important method is getFieldValue

    Creating: 

                  Line outLine = new Line(oLayout);

    Getting a field value: 

                  long sku = saleRecord.getFieldValue("KEYCODE-NO").asLong();

    Updating a field: 

                  saleRecord.getFieldValue("KEYCODE-NO").set(1331);
    Version:
    0.55
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

      • isDefined

        public boolean isDefined(IFieldDetail field)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractLine
        Check if a field is defined in the record (or line).
        For Csv / Xml files, the field must exist in the "record"
        For Fixed width files
        • The record must be long enough to hold the field
        • The field value must not be hex zero's. This creates a potential problem with Comp fields.
        Specified by:
        isDefined in interface AbstractLine
        Parameters:
        field - field-defi9ni9tion
        Returns:
        wether the field exists in the line
